column2: backpainsucks, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Having gone thru 4 spinal surgeries, I ended up with failed back surgery syndrome. Previously my resultant spasms were treated with narcotic pain medications. Feeling frustrated that I was unable to be up on my feet for short periods of time, I dug out my Amrix ER. This has made such a difference in my stamina. My spasms started from my low back up into my neck. Amrix has made a total change in my symptoms. I do experience a bit of drowsiness, but feel like I have gotten part of my quality of life back. Granted, I have a high tolerance for pain, but I firmly believe in this medication for the treatment of back spasm symptoms.

column2: jojoanddash, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I love Amrix. I have 2 bulging discs in my neck and this is the only thing that has helped enough to where I don't have to take pain pills everyday (I have pain 24/7) but this helps to where I can deal with it most days. I still have bad days from time to time but those are the days I combine Amrix with my pain meds. I take it at night & don't have any trouble getting up. It is very expensive (not sure why) but I'm on workers comp so they have to pay for it Thank God cause I def could not afford it on my own. I can only say good things about this medication.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
CindyLou, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have a severe migraine disorder and have been on so many different meds I cannot list them all here. I had little or no relief until my neurologist added Amrix 30 mg to my regime. This is the miracle drug I have been searching for!! I still get my headaches but they now respond to the migraine meds (triptans) and are less frequent. The ONLY side effect I experience is dry mouth. It is very expensive...I am anxious to try the generic form. If it does not work I will pay for brand name. It has made a huge difference in my quality of life!

column2: rachel.leo33, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I get bouts of muscle spasms in my lower back but mostly in my upper back and neck area which more often than not turn into migraines. I do take Imitrex for the migraines but needed something for the muscle spasms. The doctor prescribed Amrix ER and it worked great! I felt a little quiet and tired but as long as it continues to work I can deal with my almost non-existent side effects.

No more stacks of pain pills I can't take. This was given to me by a pain specialist. I'm so sensitive to med's. This is my miracle in a bottle. Only took since 1983 to get the right one.

The only problem is that I feel sleeping in the morning, but that is cured by getting up and getting going.

column9: experienced racing heart and face and throat swelled up like a balloon also dizzy and light headed !!!

column2: pkwarman, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this medication at 9pm and passed out. I woke up at 5am the next morning to go to the bathroom and almost fell when I got out of bed. The whole room was spinning. I went back to sleep till 7am and woke up still spinning, nauseous, and dry mouth. I was completely non functional the whole day and went back and forth between spinning uncontrollably and passing out. Luckily my husband was home to watch the kids. I am writing this almost 24hrs since i took the pill and I am still spinning and nauseous. waiting to desperately get off this ride!!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: jjop, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor said I would become sleepy about 2 hrs after taking Amrix.  It has not help me sleep at all.  It actually has had the opposite effect.  The pain from my pleurisy is much better and I am now able to lie down at night to sleep instead of having to sleep sitting up to relieve my pain.  The first night I took this, I slept well.  The second time, I was awake until 4:30 am and up for work at 6 am without feeling drowsy at all. I have more energy throughout the day but this may be working against other meds I take to help calm and slow me down.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: NeckShoulderBack, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this medicine for a neck and shoulder blade strain of moderate intensity.  I was still able to move and work but in constant discomfort including trouble sleeping.  I felt immediate relief in the area of pain an and tightness within 30 minutes of taking this drug.  As anticipated, it made me very lethargic and drowsy.  I slept for over 12 hours and had trouble rousing.  At the end of the 24 hour release cycle, I was still very dopey and experienced dry mouth and slight stomach upset but both were tolerable based on the relief to the area.  I am someone who tries to take only the minimum of muscle relaxants and pain killers during a flair up because my body has a strong and long term reaction, which seems to be the case here.  Along with physical therapy at home, the one dose of this drug was very helpful to me. I would not drive a car even the day after and missed some work, I still felt too woosey.  But the time off helped my body to heal so I don't get upset about that.  I much prefer a muscle relaxant that wears off sooner in the event that I can better control the effect.  I took this pill because it saved me a trip to the doctor (it had been prescribed the previous flare up of this same ailment) and I had received several samples.  In summation, try to have the doctor prescribe "normal" muscle relaxants as opposed to this long ball hitter for more control and less side effects, in my opinion.  I honestly believe that the drug companies leverage the doctor to push their drugs over others.  This one is only a long lasting, time release of the same drug in another form (flexeril). Feel Better Everybody!

column2: AmandaKy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this medicine at 7 pm with food. by 9 am that night I was a zombie, the next morning I woke up, felt fine so I got in the shower, and passed out completely in the shower. I fell out of the tub face forward. I woke up laying stomach down with a knot on my head and everything hurting. When I passed out I was out for 5 minutes, now have a brusied face, knees, and elbows and had a concussion. Also twice through that same day I blacked out. So needless to say NEVER NEVER NEVR NEVER NEVER AGAIN.

So amrix seems to be a good middle-ground for me so far.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: be careful of this drug -- a short time after I took it my heart started racing, my mouth went metallic and I got a headache. What is up with the pharmaceuticals?  Im sitting here wondering if I need to go to the hospital.  Maybe if they are gonna make killer pharms we should be admitted to the hospital upon before we take the pharms and be monitored at the hospital.  What has happened to USA medicine and medical care - GREED GREED GREED.  I'm sick of em. From now on I want traditional tried and true been out forever drugs - if its been recently developed in past ten years I'm not TOUCHING it.  Ever.  If I live through this dosage of the pharms trying to kill us off.  And btw NO PAIN RELIEF - NONE.  AT ALL.  We want to relax the muscle - not ramp up the heart.

column9: I am a patient suffering from herniated discs along with all symptoms of advanced chronic LYME disease.  I am reading a lot of "too groggy next morning" reviews. My problem is electricity feeling causing muscle spasms and involuntary muscle action.  ie: looking like a contortionist without any control on my part. It is very embarrassing in public. This medication is too expensive for me to buy, $647.25 for one month supply, my insurance doesn't cover it at all.  I am thankful to have had samples from Dr. office.  Those of you who are groggy, talk to your Dr. about that, dose too high? Maybe taking it too late at night?  It is too good a medication to only try once. I wish there were tons of samples out there.

column2: loretta, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had right knee surgery back in June of 2009. Needless to say I was still having a lot of pain. I would wake in the night about three,four in the morning in tears crying to my husband where my knee would be having killer spasms. I was taking flexerill three times a day, mobic, and lortab. All done no good, my doc put me on this Amrix I have been on it for a week now and I can already tell a big difference, I actually get to sleep in the night. He still wanted me to take my flexerill twice a day and this Amrix at 6pm. So happy to say I have not had to take my flexirl all week. It does make me sleepy but, he said that is why he has me taking it at 6pm that way when I go to sleep and by the time I get up for work, I will not feel so drowsey. It works for me, I just hope it can help others like it is helping me.

column9: Hi, I was given Amrix yesterday from my pain MD, I have had 16 surgeries, neck & shoulders are the most painful as well as low back and sciatica. I am normally willing to try anything my MD puts me on but this has me totally freaked out.  If I can't take flexeril how would I ever be able to take Amrix.  I get drowsy very quickly so I am worried about dropping my face in my Oatmeal.  Is this medication so strong that I would have trouble functioning the next morning?  Does the drowsiness go away after a couple of days?  Thank you so much for your help.

feelin' better, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering from muscle spasms for over 2 years now (finally found the diagnosis and know what lasting treatment will work for me) and have tried SEVERAL different medications. Every type of muscle relaxer given to me made me feel too dopey to do anything and, as a single mom, made things very difficult. I was finally given Amrix, and at first I didn't think it was doing much. After the third day the spasms were all but gone. If I go off for a day or two they return, and I need to build the level back up again. It works to keep the spasms under control.

column2: Ron, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication (Amrex) caused a severe systemic reaction; i.e., severe rash over trunk, feet, back, face. Also, I took Benadryl to counteract the rash and I believe the Benadryl and the Amrex contradicted each other which ultimately made my symptoms twice as bad.  This is a bad, bad medicine for susceptible patients and the consumer should be strongly forewarned...

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering from chronic migraines since I was 15 years old. I constantly had pain in my neck and shoulders that would not go away. One time I had a headache that lasted for two weeks straight. After that I was diagnosed with tension headaches potentially brought on by stress. I have been on amrix for almost 5 months and I love it. I take it every night at 6pm and I have to be up at 6:30am for work and it's not a problem. It made me tired at first, but once I got used to it I was fine. I still get headaches about once every two weeks or so, but I am SO grateful to have found this drug. For everyone who has problems with their co-pays- talk to your doctor, drug reps give them $30 off coupons to promote their product. My doctor gave me an entire packet of about 15 of them.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Taking this drug actually reduced the muscle spasms I was having with lower back pain.Problem is, you become a zombie 2 hours after taking the capsule (I was given 30mg capsules) for a full 24 hours.  Decide whether it is worth the price of being unproductive and lethargic the entire time you're on this drug compared to the relief you may get from muscle spasms.I prefer Valium which does the same thing without the long lasting side effects, but was told by my Doctor that this version of Flexoril minimized the extreme drowsiness that characterizes it.   It clearly does not.I will think very carefully before taking this medication a second time.

column2: Cal-Phil, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Great drug, but it is quite powerful at least with its effects/side effects. Worked wonders at relieving pain with a bulging disk, allowed me to continue on with life instantly. Gives good long-lasting relief, but did make me pass out by the end of the night. I didn't even have to take vicodin which was also prescribed for the pain. I am young and larger, so I usually don't react too strongly to medication, and it made me cottonmouth and sleepy, so I would recommend only taking a small dose until you know your personal reactions. Very good find though; relieved pain all-day and through the night, instead of taking numerous vicodins.

column2: Sissy0427, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Just a note, I see people who cannot afford this med.  Sometimes if you contact the manufacturer of the med, let them know you cann't afford it, they may be able to help you obtain it.

column2: shadowd, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for two weeks and am still experiencing mild to moderate pain each day.  Though it has brought the pain down to a bearable level.  Will continue to take it for the time being according to my doctors directions.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have fibromyalgia. I have chronic pain, mainly in my legs, face, and back. I also have muscle twitches that can last for days. Since starting Amrix about 3 weeks ago, I haven't had any muscle twitching and no severe pain. Not sure is any what result this has done for the pain and twitching because I am taking other medications for them too. I usually have strong side effects from medications and I have not had any.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It has taken one full week to start to see any progress.  I'm not certain it is from the drug itself, or just time and resting.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Geri, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug is wonderful for my undiagnosed muscle, tendon pain.  The only thing negative is the cost.  We need a lower cost drug and one that is covered by insurance

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Was given this med as an alternative to valium. I developed severve muscle spasms and pain. It has help alot, some dizziness and fog brain for a few days. After a week, i have some fog brain, no other side effects after 3 days.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: jacksharleygirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
kbbaltimore, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Was prescribed this for my lower back pain.  I have degenerative disc and severe muscle spasms.   I took this for a week and felt absolutely no change.

column2: butlerwc, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed with this medications to help the muscle tension associated from my migraines, it did not ease any tension.  It did cause some minor nausia at first, but eased after about four days.

i have disk problems, 3 are already fused from earlier in life only have 2 left which has alot of wear and tear on , dr. give me these to take 15 mg. they seem to help along with vicodin. I got on here and found out it is a risk to take if you have a overactive thyroid, in which i do, wonder what it does with a thyroid problem?  I have been on them for about a month now 1 a day. before that i was on the regular flexiril for years, dr. thougt these time released amrix 15 would do better.

column2: indiansprings, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Amrix, is a miracle medication, I have multiple back problems,4 herniated discs, spinal stenosis,degenerative disc diease ect,and pain medication {oxycotin}could not help, or give me the relief from pain the way AMRIX did. the first day I was a little grogy, but other wise, no serious side effects,or side effects at all, and by the second day,my chronic pain has dropped down from a constant 8-9 on pain medication, to 3-4, with Amrix, and half the dose of pain meds. I will not stop taking it, as it has helped me tremendously , giving me some of my life back, from severe chronic pain !

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: trudy@2watchugrow.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: A car accident has left me in chronic pain for 4+ years.Amrix has replaced Skelaxin and I've cut down to 1 Norco a day, still taking 1800mg of Neurotin daily.  I'm able to wakeup w/o pain when taken before bedtime. Sideeffects,dry mouth, blurred vision, facial rash, slight wt. gain due 2 increased fluids, no stomache pain if taken at night.  When on Amrix I feel 95% better and I'm able to sleep through the night w/o waking up in pain throughout the night.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: kat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this in sample form to relieve some of the pain of fibromyalgia, after trying so many others I had hoped for the best, but it caused so much jumpiness in my legs (restless leg syndrome?)I could not sleep, which of course makes the pain worse.  it only marginally helped the pain, but not enough to warrant the side effect and upset stomach.  I'll keep trying others, i guess.

column2: melkelley68, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this med for severe protruding hern. discs. After an hour into this med I broke out in hives and itched for hours. About the same as flexeril. Being switched to Skelaxin so I hope it helps.

column2: TM, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've suffered from what the doctor believes are stress induced miagraines.  He felt that Amrix would allow my shoulders to relax and therefore relieve the headaches.  The pain in the headaches is not as severe - but they are still present.  Don't know if this drug is helping as well as I hoped.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: ldcota93, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have FM, Den. JT. Dis. in my neck and knees, PCOS, cervical stenosis. I have taken this drug for 1 week, and have noticed much better control of my mm spasms and pain. I have lived with pain and many similar drugs for 10 yrs. now. Only take this at night tho... It can make you a little "goofy".

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: gwinnalice, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First day, it made me a bit jiottery.  Second day, I felt 90 per cent better.  Taken along wioth codein, I am almost out of pain.  Thank you.

column2: Lilac Kitty, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i have degenerative disc disease, arthritis, etc. etc. and i am on a huge cocktail of meds. i was able to take this at bedtime and get rid of taking 4 other pills a day (3 skelaxin and 1 flexeril) much nicer and easier. just as expensive as the skelaxin and saved money by not having the flexeril any more. so a good switch overall. i feel good. not great but just as good as on the other 2.would recommend hopefully as good to you as was to me.

column2: Jenny B, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My dDr. started me on it 2 wks ago, after 1 week I left him know that it wasn't helping with the pain. (Fibro & Degenerative Disc Disease)he advised that I up it from 15 mg at bedtime to 30 at bedtime...still no relief and I can't sleep and my stomach stays upset.  I am not going to take it anymore as I have enough issues with pain and medications messing up my stomach and digestive sys.  Oh well keep on as a guinea pig I guess.  I cannot tolerate any serious narcotic/opiate pain meds.  Between the Fibro and Disc problems I am a walking Muscle Spasm, I don't remember what it is like to have a day pain free.

column2: Kathy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I recently began taking this medication for severe muscle spasms from Fibromyalgia. I have found it to be somewhat effective, certainly better than Flexeril or any other muscle relaxer I've tried.

column2: cowgurl67, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have hynerated dics in both back and neck and stay in pain constantly. I just started taking this medicine about 5 days ago. I have taken flexeril for years now and never really received the releif I felt I needed. I'm guessing that since this is extended release it could be the reason I feel a little relief. I don't feel groggy or drowsey from taking this medicine. I plan on continuing this medicine to see if over time it will help my pain more. I'm not sure how expensive it is, but when my doctor gave me samples, they also gave me a coupon for up to $20 off, the doc made the comment that it must be really expensive to offer $20 off. I'm on workman's comp, so they paid for it. I probably wouldn't have been able to get it if I had to pay for it.
